results.content: I love Jose's style of teaching. His course is well-structured, simplified, and concise, with many exercises and challenging problems to test our language understanding. I have learned a lot from his python course, and  I believe the solid foundation I have obtained from his python course will help me a lot in my career as a researcher. I will enroll in his other recent courses to acquire more in-depth programming skills and become a full-fledged advanced developer.

I will enroll in his other recent courses to acquire more in-depth programming skills and become a full-fledged advanced developer.

results.content: I love the way this course has been made so interactive. So much to learn and practice. I know this is not over , rather just a begining in the learning path of python. So much to explore. Thank you for a fruitful tutorial contents.

results.content: I was a fantastic experience overall. It was my first lesson on any computer language, I enjoyed it. But one thing I want to mention here that the first milestone project was a huge jump for a beginner like me. It would have been really great if there were some small projects or exercises before jumping to milestone project.

results.content:
I loved the explanation, the clarity in concepts, the ease of teaching and challenging with homework questions
Only thing I would appreciate if there is inclusion of certain discussion on what are the concepts that are asked in interviews more often

results.content:
Before writing my review thank you Jose for making such a great course.Project were extremely helpfull, I hope your Django course also gets more projects like this.

Before starting this course I was a complete beginner. After completing this course in 9 weeks(avg. 3 - 4 hours a day) I have understood everything that was given in the course. I really recommend this course.

The reason why I gave 4.5 stars is some concepts were just rushed quickly as I understood what Jose was doing but didn't really understand the logic behind so had to do lots of google search.

I know If he spent time on explaining every logic behind each line course would never finish.

Also I wish OOP lectures had more exercises just like Methods and Functions.

Before taking this course If you feel like you want to go to course and you dont want to  study online, I wouldn't really recommend that.Because the best part of this course was whatever I couldn't find online or couldn't understand It was either asked or Jose's teachers were responding my questions immidiately.
results.content_html:
Before writing my review thank you Jose for making such a great course.Project were extremely helpfull, I hope your Django course also gets more projects like this.

Before starting this course I was a complete beginner. After completing this course in 9 weeks(avg. 3 - 4 hours a day) I have understood everything that was given in the course. I really recommend this course.

The reason why I gave 4.5 stars is some concepts were just rushed quickly as I understood what Jose was doing but didn't really understand the logic behind so had to do lots of google search.

I know If he spent time on explaining every logic behind each line course would never finish.

Also I wish OOP lectures had more exercises just like Methods and Functions.

Before taking this course If you feel like you want to go to course and you dont want to study online, I wouldn't really recommend that.Because the best part of this course was whatever I couldn't find online or couldn't understand It was either asked or Jose's teachers were responding my questions immidiately.

results.content: Amazing course for Python, Really great explanation and covers very much everything there to start your career in Python.
results.content_html: Amazing course for Python, Really great explanation and covers very much everything there to start your career in Python.

results.content:
Because it is organized in a comprehensible way. The instructor's voice pitch and approach are perfect in my opinion.
But after I did the exams for the PCEP-30-01, PCEP-30-02 I discovered that there are some basic topics that were not covered even after reaching chapter 12 such as and not limited to: 
- Function(variable, end="") this "end" thing at the end.
- Bin(), AND, OR, |. the base of the binary is 2. (The Whole Topic)
- Within a  a while loop or an if statements > continue to skip that iteration.
- I have passed both exams and have wrote some code of my own but still I find it very difficult to think my way through complicated multi levels while or for loops which is how the you get tested. (an advise on this would be really really appreciated what am I missing.)
-The whole Array union intersection topic, I failed every question I faced on it.
results.content_html:
Because it is organized in a comprehensible way. The instructor's voice pitch and approach are perfect in my opinion.
But after I did the exams for the PCEP-30-01, PCEP-30-02 I discovered that there are some basic topics that were not covered even after reaching chapter 12 such as and not limited to:
- Function(variable, end="") this "end" thing at the end.
- Bin(), AND, OR, |. the base of the binary is 2. (The Whole Topic)
- Within a a while loop or an if statements > continue to skip that iteration.
- I have passed both exams and have wrote some code of my own but still I find it very difficult to think my way through complicated multi levels while or for loops which is how the you get tested. (an advise on this would be really really appreciated what am I missing.)
-The whole Array union intersection topic, I failed every question I faced on it.
